meanings.definition: The group of spectators or listeners at a public event.
meanings.sent1: The audience clapped loudly at the end of the play.
meanings.sent2: The movie attracted a large audience on opening night.
meanings.sent3: The audience giggled when the actor's wig fell off.
meanings.sent4: The audience's cheers were like a wave of sound.
meanings.sent5: The audience's excitement filled the room.

meanings.definition: The people reached by a book, movie, or radio or television program.
meanings.sent1: The author's new novel captivated the audience with its twists.
meanings.sent2: The TV show had a wide audience of all ages.
meanings.sent3: The audience was surprised by the unexpected plot twist.
meanings.sent4: The audience's interest in the story was like a flame.
meanings.sent5: The audience's laughter echoed through the theater.

meanings.definition: A formal interview with a person in authority.
meanings.sent1: The journalist conducted an interview with the mayor in front of an audience.
meanings.sent2: The audience listened intently to the CEO's speech.
meanings.sent3: The audience gasped when the tough questions were asked.
meanings.sent4: The audience's attention was a spotlight on the speaker.
meanings.sent5: The audience's questions probed deep into the topic.
